case_vignette: A 29-year-old African-American woman, gravida 4, para 0, comes to the physician for evaluation of recurrent abortions! Each pregnancy resulted in spontaneous abortion in the second trimester! The patient has a history of joint pain, chronic migraines, and recurrent poorly defined, macular skin rashes! She also reports episodes in which her fingers become pale and cold, and then redden! She is sexually active with her husband and does not use contraceptives! The patient works as a landscape architect! Her mother has a history of endometriosis! The patient takes a daily prenatal multivitamin and occasionally sumatriptan! She appears tired! Temperature is 36!5°C (97!7°F), pulse is 65/min, and blood pressure is 110/65 mm Hg! Examination of the hands shows two ulcerations on the tip of the right index finger and multiple tiny hemorrhages under the nails! There is a purple reticular rash on both calves!
question: Which  is most likely to confirm the diagnosis?

trial_0.vignette_frq: Antinuclear antibody (ANA) test and anti-Smith antibody test.

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Rheumatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?

I've been experiencing joint pain, chronic migraines, skin rashes, and my fingers sometimes turn pale and cold before reddening. Also, I have had recurrent spontaneous abortions in the second trimester.
How long have you been experiencing these symptoms?
I have been experiencing these symptoms for several years now.
Do you have any family history of autoimmune diseases or similar symptoms?
My mother has a history of endometriosis.
Have you undergone any specific tests or received any previous diagnosis related to your current symptoms?
No, I have not received any specific diagnosis related to my current symptoms.
Are you currently on any medications?
Yes, I take a daily prenatal multivitamin and occasionally sumatriptan.
Have your symptoms ever improved or worsened with sun exposure?
Yes, my skin rashes worsen with sun exposure.
Final Diagnosis: Systemic Lupus Erythematosus (SLE)

trial_0.summarized_conversation: A patient has been suffering from joint pain, chronic migraines, skin rashes, and episodes where their fingers turn pale and cold before becoming red. Additionally, the patient has experienced recurrent spontaneous abortions in the second trimester. These symptoms have been present for several years. The patient's mother has a history of endometriosis. The patient has not yet received a specific diagnosis regarding these symptoms. The patient takes a daily prenatal multivitamin and occasionally uses sumatriptan. The patient also notes that their skin rashes worsen with sun exposure.
